title: English Home
content:
Corpus of Conversational Uyghur Language English Uyghur Coming Soon The Corpus of Conversational Uyghur Welcome! This collection of recordings represents a record of Modern Uyghur as used in casual
          conversation by diaspora speakers in the early 21 st century. The conversations are unscripted,
          unplanned, and recorded by the participants themselves in their homes or other spaces, with no
          researcher present. This corpus is intended to be a resource for anyone learning Uyghur on their own, teaching
          Uyghur to others, or doing research on various aspects of Uyghur language and linguistics. The
          contents may be used freely for any of these purposes.
          Most of the conversations were recorded with the participants’ phones. Some of them used the
          iPhone settings that record full-quality lossless audio; others used the regular settings that
          involve some compression of the sound. One conversation was recorded over Zoom. The
          metadata on the page for each conversation specifies the details. An explanation of the transcription conventions, the Uyghur Latin Script used in the transcripts,
          and the abbreviations used for the grammatical analysis can be found here . Each transcript can also be downloaded as an .xml file and also as an .eaf file, which can be
          opened in the program ELAN along with the
          audio. To download a zip file containing all the recordings and transcripts, click here . Conversation 1 Download audio file: Conversation1.mp3 Download transcript file: Conversation1.eaf Download XML: Conversation1.xml View Online: Conversation 1 A Zoom call between two colleagues who both teach Uyghur language classes, discussing
work, family, and a variety of other topics. Conversation 2 Download audio file: Conversation2.mp3 Download transcript file: Conversation2.eaf Download XML: Conversation2.xml View Online: Conversation 2 A husband and wife chat after a meal about their memories of music, life, and culture in their
hometown. Conversation 3 Download audio file: Conversation3.mp3 Download transcript file: Conversation3.eaf Download XML: Conversation3.xml View Online: Conversation 3 Two friends take a walk in the park and chat about health, diet, and work. Conversation 4 Download audio file: Conversation4.mp3 Download transcript file: Conversation4.eaf Download XML: Conversation4.xml View Online: Conversation 4 A conversation between two family members at home after school. More conversations coming soon Check back for updates Contact: Email - mfiddler@ucsb.edu Web design - Haibibullah Abdul-Kerim *Project organized by Michael Fiddler, in collaboration with the Uyghur Projects Foundation © Copyright Michael Fiddler 2022

Seg bir nerse bir nerse néme qil-mi-d-uq Gloss one thing one thing what do-NEG-PST-1PL English We haven’t gotten to do anything. Speaker B Timestamp 00:03:21.792-00:03:24.156 IU U siler terepte waksinni bashlidima? Seg bir Gloss one English Like… Timestamp 00:11:24.071-00:11:26.553 IU altimu – beshmu adem teshkillengen, Seg alti-mu besh-mu adem teshkille-n-gen Gloss six-INT five-INT person organize-PASS-PTCP.PST English five or siz people were organized, Timestamp 00:11:27.302-00:11:29.432 IU dangliq bir muzikantlar barti. Seg hm-mm Gloss hm-mm English Mm-hm. Speaker A Timestamp 00:11:35.254-00:11:38.693 IU Kéyin he pul tölep qoyup, toy bolidighan küni néme bolsap, yene birsi bérip, Seg kéyin he pul töle-p qoy-up toy bol-idighan kün-i néme bol-sa-p yene bir-si bér-ip Gloss after uh money pay-CVB AUX.qoy-CVB wedding be-PTCP.PRES day-3POSS what be-COND-?? again one-3POSS go-CVB English Afterwards, you’d pay them their fee, then on the day of the wedding if something happened, someone else would go, Timestamp 00:11:38.981-00:11:40.844 IU azraq-jiqraq pul bériptiken, Seg az-raq jiq-raq pul bér-ipt-iken Gloss little-COMP many-COMP money give-PST.EVID-EVID English and offer him more money, Timestamp 00:11:40.844-00:11:42.390 IU undaq bolsa, uningkige baridighan qip qoyuptu shuninggha, Seg undaq bol-sa u-ningki-ge bar-idighan qi-p qoy-upt-du shu-ning-gha Gloss thus be-COND that-GEN-DAT exist-PTCP.PRES do-CVB AUX.qoy-PST.EVID-3 that-GEN-DAT English in that case, that person who tried to go to him, Timestamp 00:11:42.390-00:11:44.091 IU shuninggha, biz uningdin jiqraq bérip, Seg shu-ning-gha biz u-ning-din jiq-raq bér-ip Gloss that-GEN-DAT 1PL 3SG-GEN-ABL many-COMP give-CVB English so we gave more money than they did, Timestamp 00:11:44.428-00:11:45.261 IU ashuni ekelgen, Seg ashu-ni ekel-gen Gloss that-ACC bring-PTCP.PST English and we brought him in, Speaker B Timestamp 00:11:44.489-00:11:45.352 IU [xxx] [xxx]. Seg [xxx] [xxx] Gloss [xxx] [xxx] English [xxx] [xxx]. Speaker A Timestamp 00:11:45.261-00:11:46.196 IU he'e ekelgentuq. Seg he'e ekel-gen-t-uq Gloss yes bring-PTCP.PST-PST-1PL English Yeah we brought it. Timestamp 00:11:46.639-00:11:48.277 IU Shu seksen he... Seg shu seksen he Gloss that eighty uh English That was in nineteen eighty- uh… Timestamp 00:11:48.933-00:11:50.230 IU töt – seksen beshinchi yilimu, Seg töt seksen besh-inchi yil-i-mu Gloss four eighty five-ORD year-3POSS-INT English four – eighty-five, Timestamp 00:11:50.249-00:11:51.802 IU akam qachan toy qildi rast ikkinchi akam? Seg aka-m qachan toy qil-d-i rast ikki-inchi aka-m Gloss older.brother-1SG.POSS when wedding do-PST-3 true two-ORD older.brother-1SG.POSS English when did my brother get married exactly, my second brother? Speaker B Timestamp 00:11:52.157-00:11:54.051 IU Seks-- seksen besh qildi. Seg seks-- seksen besh qil-d-i Gloss * eighty five do-PST-3 English It was in ’eighty-five. Speaker B Timestamp 00:11:54.230-00:11:54.642 IU He'e. Seg he'e Gloss yes English Yeah. Speaker A Timestamp 00:11:54.740-00:11:55.188 IU He'e shu. Seg he'e shu Gloss yes that English Yeah that’s right. Timestamp 00:11:55.190-00:11:56.206 IU Seksen besh [xxx]. Seg seksen besh [xxx] Gloss eighty five [xxx] English ’Eighty-five [xxx]. Speaker B Timestamp 00:11:55.678-00:11:58.398 IU Biz oqushqa [xxx] ikkinchi yili yaz tetilde qildi. Seg biz oqu-sh-qa [xxx] ikki-inchi yil-i yaz tetil-de qil-d-i Gloss 1PL study-GER-DAT [xxx] two-ORD year-3POSS summer vacation-LOC do-PST-3 English He got married in summer vacation in the second year we were studying [xxx]. Speaker A Timestamp 00:11:56.658-00:11:57.116 IU He'e. Seg he'e Gloss yes English Uh-huh. Timestamp 00:11:57.379-00:11:57.902 IU Toghra. Seg toghra Gloss correct English Right. Timestamp 00:11:58.730-00:11:59.908 IU Hazirmu ésimde bar. Seg hazir-mu és-im-de bar Gloss now-INT mind-1SG.POSS-LOC exist English Now I remember. Speaker B Timestamp 00:12:00.110-00:12:00.956 IU Hm-mm hm-mm Seg hm-mm hm-mm Gloss hm-mm hm-mm English Mm-hm, mm-hm. Speaker A Timestamp 00:12:00.974-00:12:03.730 IU Shu chaghlarda héliqi, shu rehmetlik Abdurazaq-- Seg shu chagh-lar-da héliqi shu rehmetlik Abdurazaq Gloss that time-PL-LOC that that deceased (name) English In those days the late Abdurazaq Timestamp 00:12:04.337-00:12:05.269 IU ussul oynap, Seg ussul oyna-p Gloss dance play-CVB English would dance, Timestamp 00:12:05.283-00:12:05.928 IU oyun, Seg oyun Gloss game English performance, Speaker B Timestamp 00:12:06.092-00:12:07.985 IU Ajayip qabiliyetlik ademti [xxx]. Seg ajayip qabiliyetlik adem-ti [xxx] Gloss extremely capable person-XPST [xxx] English He was a really capable man [xxx]. Seg he'e Gloss yes English Uh-huh. Speaker A Timestamp 00:12:09.660-00:12:10.519 IU ussulchi. Seg ussul-chi Gloss dance-AG English a dancer. Timestamp 00:12:11.818-00:12:14.341 IU Bir ömür shu sahede ishlep ölüp ketti mana. Seg bir ömür shu sahe-de ishle-p öl-üp ket-t-i mana Gloss one lifespan that field-LOC work-CVB die-CVB leave-PST-3 look.here English He worked in that field his whole life and then died. Speaker B Timestamp 00:12:14.095-00:12:14.610 IU Hm-mm. Seg hm-mm Gloss hm-mm English Mm-hm. Speaker A Timestamp 00:12:16.265-00:12:17.918 IU Undaq se'netkarlar bek jiq. Seg undaq sen'etkar-lar bek jiq Gloss thus artist-PL very many English There are a lot of artists like that. Speaker B Timestamp 00:12:17.990-00:12:18.631 IU He'e. Seg he'e Gloss yes English Yeah. Speaker A Timestamp 00:12:18.946-00:12:19.573 IU [xxx]-- Seg [xxx] Gloss [xxx] English [xxx]-- Speaker B Timestamp 00:12:18.955-00:12:21.090 IU Tebi'iy se'netkarlar bek jiq kuchada. Seg tebi'iy sen'etkar-lar bek jiq kucha-da Gloss natural artist-PL very many Kucha(city)-LOC English There are a lot of natural artists in Kucha. Speaker A Timestamp 00:12:19.573-00:12:20.158 IU He'e. Seg he'e Gloss yes English Yeah. Timestamp 00:12:20.566-00:12:22.259 IU Shu...waqti, Seg shu waqt-i Gloss that time-3POSS English That…time, Timestamp 00:12:22.880-00:12:24.760 IU waqit ötkendinkin untulup mangidighan gep, Seg waqit öt-ken-dinkin untu-l-up mang-idighan gep Gloss time pass-PTCP.PST-since forget-PASS-CVB walk-PTCP.PRES thing English since that time passed these things started to be forgotten, Timestamp 00:12:24.760-00:12:26.139 IU uni yézip qoyidighan ademmu yoq, Seg u-ni yéz-ip qoy-idighan adem-mu yoq Gloss that-ACC write-CVB AUX.qoy-PTCP.PRES person-also not.exist English there was nobody writing them down, Timestamp 00:12:26.149-00:12:27.822 IU tarixqa qaldurup qoyidighan ademmu yoq, Seg tarix-qa qal-dur-up qoy-idighan adem-mu yoq Gloss history-DAT remain-CAUS-CVB AUX.qoy-PTCP.PRES person-also not.exist English nobody recording them for history, Speaker B Timestamp 00:12:27.616-00:12:28.048 IU Hm-mm. Seg hm-mm Gloss hm-mm English Mm-hm. Speaker A Timestamp 00:12:28.077-00:12:29.654 IU xelq sen'etkarliri. Seg xelq sen'etkar-lir-i Gloss folk artist-PL-3POSS English The folk artists. Timestamp 00:12:31.458-00:12:34.548 IU Manda eslise adem, ésige kélidu. Seg manda esli-se adem és-i-ge kél-i-du Gloss thus remember-COND person mind-3POSS-DAT come-PRES-3 English If one thinks about them like this, they come to mind. Timestamp 00:12:35.359-00:12:38.750 IU Lékin bashqilardin, hazir yash balilardin sorisa héchkim uqmaydu ularni. Seg lékin bashqi-lar-din hazir yash bali-lar-din sori-sa héchkim uq-ma-y-du ular-ni Gloss but other-PL-ABL now young child-PL-ABL ask-COND none-who know-NEG-PRES-3 3PL-ACC English But others, if you ask the young kids now, nobody knows them. Speaker B Timestamp 00:12:40.067-00:12:43.003 IU Aman'gülning toyidimu her bir, her bir gépide, Seg Amangül-ning toy-i-di-mu her bir her bir gép-i-de Gloss (name)-GEN wedding-3POSS-LOC-also every one every one thing-3POSS-LOC English At Aman'gül’s wedding too, in every part of it, Timestamp 00:12:44.677-00:12:46.366 IU a terep – ma terepke ötüp bashlidi. Seg a terep ma terep-ke öt-üp bashli-d-i Gloss that side this side-DAT pass-CVB AUX.bashli-PST-3 English he started just going this way and that. Timestamp 00:12:46.458-00:12:49.283 IU Légende poloni ekep bérip, qordaqni ekétip bérip ashu, Seg légen-de polo-ni eke-p bér-ip qordaq-ni ekét-ip bér-ip ashu Gloss tray-LOC pilaf-ACC bring-CVB AUX.ber-CVB stew-ACC take-CVB AUX.ber-CVB that English He brought the pilaf in on a big tray, he brought the stew, Timestamp 00:12:50.221-00:12:51.687 IU besh alte qoshaqni qiliwétip, Seg besh alte qoshaq-ni qil-iwét-ip Gloss five six folk.song-ACC do-INTENS-CVB English he did five or six songs, Timestamp 00:12:52.153-00:12:54.474 IU emdi, ashu ademni bir sözletmiduq shu chaghda. Seg emdi ashu adem-ni bir sözle-t-mi-d-uq shu chagh-da Gloss now that person-ACC one speak-CAUS-NEG-PST-1PL that time-LOC English we didn’t even give him a chance to speak that time. Timestamp 00:12:55.264-00:12:59.405 IU Ashundaq bir purset bolmay qaldi aldirashtin [xxx] bop kettuq [xxx] [xxx]. Seg ashundaq bir purset bol-may qal-d-i aldirash-tin [xxx] bo-p ket-t-uq [xxx] [xxx] Gloss thus one opportunity be-NEG.CVB AUX.qal-PST-3 busy-ABL [xxx] be-CVB AUX.ket-PST-1PL [xxx] [xxx] English He didn’t have the opportunity we were [xxx] so busy [xxx] [xxx]. Speaker A Timestamp 00:12:57.936-00:13:01.522 IU Emdi u chaghlarda undaq bir ehmiyitini chüshenmigen waqitlar. Seg emdi u chagh-lar-da undaq bir ehmiyit-i-ni chüshen-mi-gen waqit-lar Gloss now that time-PL-LOC thus one attention-3POSS-ACC understand-NEG-PTCP.PST time-PL English In those times, those were times when we didn’t understand the importance of it. Speaker B Timestamp 00:13:01.196-00:13:01.623 IU He'e. Seg he'e Gloss yes English Yeah. Speaker A Timestamp 00:13:01.754-00:13:03.249 IU U chaghda bizmu kichik, Seg u chagh-da biz-mu kichik Gloss that time-LOC 1PL-also small English We were young then too, Timestamp 00:13:03.537-00:13:07.190 IU sen'etning kültöri, bashqa nersilerning qimmitini chüshenmigen waqitlar. Seg sen'et-ning kültör-i bashqa nersi-ler-ning qimmit-i-ni chüshen-mi-gen waqit-lar Gloss art(s)-GEN culture-3POSS other thing-PL-GEN value-3POSS-ACC understand-NEG-PTCP.PST time-PL English those were times when we didn’t understand arts culture, the value of other things. Timestamp 00:13:07.215-00:13:09.178 IU Hazir ma yerge chiqqandinkin ma yerde yashap turup, Seg hazir ma yer-ge chiq-qan-dinkin ma yer-de yasha-p tur-up Gloss now this place-DAT go.up-PTCP.PST-since this place-LOC live-CVB stand-CVB English Since we’ve moved here, we live here now, Timestamp 00:13:09.476-00:13:11.570 IU ashu nersilerning qanchilik qimmetlik, Seg ashu nersi-ler-ning qanchilik qimmet-lik Gloss that thing-PL-GEN how.much value-DER English we feel how valuable, Timestamp 00:13:11.760-00:13:13.073 IU muhim ikenlikini hés qiliwatimiz. Seg muhim iken-lik-i-ni hés qil-iwat-imiz Gloss important EVID-DER-3POSS-ACC feeling do-CONT-1PL English how important those things are, Speaker B Timestamp 00:13:12.812-00:13:13.474 IU Uh-huh, uh-huh. Seg uh-huh uh-huh Gloss uh-huh uh-huh English He'e he'e. Speaker A Timestamp 00:13:13.361-00:13:15.302 IU Shunga bilip bolghili bolmaydighan gep. Seg shunga bil-ip bol-ghili bol-ma-ydighan gep Gloss so know-CVB AUX.bol-PURP be-NEG-PTCP.PRES thing English So the fact is, it wouldn’t be possible to know it. Speaker B Timestamp 00:13:15.836-00:13:16.422 IU Rast. Seg rast Gloss true English True. Speaker A Timestamp 00:13:17.190-00:13:19.559 IU Bu nersiler asta asta yoqalghandinkin andin bilidighan gep, Seg bu nersi-ler asta asta yoqa-l-ghan-dinkin andin bil-idighan gep Gloss this thing-PL slowly slowly disappear-PASS-PTCP.PST-since then know-PTCP.PRES thing English Since these things slowly disappeared and then the things that were known, Timestamp 00:13:19.559-00:13:21.405 IU «hey ejep eyni chaghda ashuningdin bir, Seg hey ejep eyni chagh-da ashu-ning-din bir Gloss hey strangely original time-LOC that-GEN-ABL one English it’s like, “Hey, it’s strange that at the time, Timestamp 00:13:21.927-00:13:26.221 IU xatire qaldurmaptimen, awazgha éliwalmaptimen, yaki widé'o éliwalmaptimen» dégendek. Seg xatire qal-dur-ma-pt-imen awaz-gha él-iwal-ma-pt-imen yaki widé'o él-iwal-ma-pt-imen dé-gen-dek Gloss record remain-CAUS-NEG-PST.EVID-1SG voice-DAT take-SELF.BEN-NEG-PST.EVID-1SG or video take-SELF.BEN-NEG-PST.EVID-1SG say-PTCP.PST-SIM English I didn’t make any record of it, never took an audio recording, never took a video.” Speaker B Timestamp 00:13:25.335-00:13:25.981 IU Hm-mm hm-mm. Seg hm-mm hm-mm Gloss hm-mm hm-mm English Mm-hm, mm-hm. Timestamp 00:13:26.394-00:13:26.924 IU Rast. Seg rast Gloss true English True. Speaker A Timestamp 00:13:27.232-00:13:28.921 IU Hazir izdise u nersilermu yoq, Seg hazir izdi-se u nersi-ler-mu yoq Gloss now look.for-COND that thing-PL-also not.exist English Now if you look for them, these things are gone, Timestamp 00:13:28.921-00:13:30.745 IU ular bilidighan nersiliri özi bilen bille, Seg ular bil-idighan nersi-lir-i öz-i bilen bille Gloss 3PL know-PTCP.PRES thing-PL-3POSS self-3POSS with together English the things they knew, along with the artists themselves, Timestamp 00:13:31.105-00:13:31.653 IU yoqidi. Seg yoqi-d-i Gloss disappear-PST-3 English have disappeared. Speaker B Timestamp 00:13:31.663-00:13:32.148 IU He'e. Seg he'e Gloss yes English Yeah. Speaker A Timestamp 00:13:32.840-00:13:33.740 IU Bizning ashundaq bolidu, Seg biz-ning ashundaq bol-i-du Gloss 1PL-GEN thus be-PRES-3 English It’s that way for us, Timestamp 00:13:33.740-00:13:35.186 IU bizning bilidighan nersilirimizmu, Seg biz-ning bil-idighan nersi-lir-imiz-mu Gloss 1PL-GEN know-PTCP.PRES thing-PL-1PL.POSS-also English the things we know also, Timestamp 00:13:35.621-00:13:37.610 IU kichik waqtimizda körgen mehelliler, Seg kichik waqt-imiz-da kör-gen mehelli-ler Gloss small time-1PL.POSS-LOC see-PTCP.PST neighborhood-PL English the neighborhoods we saw when we were young, Timestamp 00:13:38.250-00:13:39.698 IU kichik waqtimizda bilidighan... Seg kichik waqt-imiz-da bil-idighan Gloss small time-1PL.POSS-LOC know-PTCP.PRES English the people we knew when we were young... Timestamp 00:13:40.111-00:13:40.991 IU ademler, Seg adem-ler Gloss person-PL English (translated in previous line) Timestamp 00:13:42.056-00:13:44.168 IU bir mezgildin kéyin yoqaydighan gep. Seg bir mezgil-din kéyin yoqa-ydighan gep Gloss one time.period-ABL after disappear-PTCP.PRES thing English after a period of time things disappear. Speaker B Timestamp 00:13:44.586-00:13:45.230 IU Rast. Seg rast Gloss true English True. title: English Conversation 3
content: Corpus of Conversational Uyghur Language English Uyghur Coming Soon Conversation 3 Select Tiers to Display Intonation Unit Segmented Text Gloss English Translation 00:00/00:00 0.25 0.5 0.75 1 1.25 1.5 1.75 2 Scroll to top Scroll to bottom for metadata Speaker A Timestamp 00:00:01.700-00:00:03.122 IU Essalamu-aleykum yaxshimusiz? Seg essalamu-aleykum yaxshi-mu-siz Gloss greeting good-INT-2SG.POL English Hello, how are you? Speaker B Timestamp 00:00:03.460-00:00:05.644 IU We-eleykum-essalam, yaxshi rehmet. Seg we-eleykum-essalam yaxshi rehmet Gloss greeting(reply) good thanks English Hello, I’m fine, thanks. Speaker A Timestamp 00:00:06.115-00:00:06.770 IU Qandaq tinch-- Seg qandaq tinch-- Gloss how * English How are-- Speaker B Timestamp 00:00:06.177-00:00:06.908 IU Yaxshi turdingiz? Seg yaxshi tur-d-ingiz Gloss good stand-PST-2SG.POL.POSS English Are you doing well? Speaker A Timestamp 00:00:07.058-00:00:07.698 IU Men yaxshi, Seg men yaxshi Gloss 1SG good English I’m good, Timestamp 00:00:07.698-00:00:08.602 IU özingizchu, obdanmu? Seg öz-ingiz-chu obdan-mu Gloss self-2SG.POL.POSS-TOP well-INT English how about you, are you good? Speaker B Timestamp 00:00:08.721-00:00:09.309 IU Yaxshi. Seg yaxshi Gloss good English I’m fine. Speaker A Timestamp 00:00:09.152-00:00:10.208 IU Xizmetler turmushlar, Seg xizmet-ler turmush-lar Gloss work-PL life-PL English Work, life, Timestamp 00:00:10.283-00:00:11.256 IU jayida kétiwatamdu? Seg jay-i-da két-iwat-am-du Gloss place-3POSS-LOC leave-CONT-INT-3 English everything going well? Speaker B Timestamp 00:00:11.158-00:00:12.618 IU Yaxshi, normal, rehmet. Seg yaxshi normal rehmet Gloss good normal thanks English Everything’s fine, as normal, thanks. Speaker A Timestamp 00:00:12.543-00:00:13.842 IU Salametlikingiz yaxshimu? Seg salametlik-ingiz yaxshi-mu Gloss health-2SG.POL.POSS good-INT English How’s your health? Speaker B Timestamp 00:00:13.923-00:00:15.177 IU He'e qedir ehwal. Seg he'e qedir ehwal Gloss yes value situation English Yeah, I’m doing fine. Speaker A Timestamp 00:00:15.147-00:00:16.506 IU Bügün ejep issiq kün boptu. Seg bügün ejep issiq kün bo-pt-u Gloss today very hot day be-PST.EVID-3 English Today was a really warm day. Speaker B Timestamp 00:00:16.726-00:00:17.221 IU He'e. Seg he'e Gloss yes English Yeah. Timestamp 00:00:17.304-00:00:19.878 IU Hazir he...etiyaz pesli bolghandinkin, Seg hazir he etiyaz pesl-i bol-ghan-dinkin Gloss now uh spring season-3POSS be-PTCP.PST-since English These days um…since spring is here, Timestamp 00:00:20.225-00:00:22.281 IU etiyazning hawasi bügün shundaq yaxshi boptu, Seg etiyaz-ning hawa-si bügün shundaq yaxshi bo-pt-u Gloss spring-GEN weather-3POSS today thus good be-PST.EVID-3 English the spring weather is really nice today, Timestamp 00:00:22.359-00:00:22.916 IU her halda. Seg her hal-da Gloss every situation-LOC English anyway. Speaker A Timestamp 00:00:22.581-00:00:23.580 IU Men xiyalimda-- Seg men xiyal-im-da Gloss 1SG thought-1SG.POSS-LOC English I think-- Timestamp 00:00:23.580-00:00:25.146 IU bu qétim, bu yil, Seg bu qétim bu yil Gloss this time this year English this time, this year, Timestamp 00:00:25.386-00:00:27.186 IU yazni kéchikip kétermikin dep oylighantim, Seg yaz-ni kéchik-ip két-er-mikin de-p oyli-ghan-ti-m Gloss summer-ACC be.late-CVB AUX.ket-AOR-UNCERT say-CVB think-PTCP.PST-XPST-1SG English I thought summer was coming late, Timestamp 00:00:27.186-00:00:28.579 IU qarisam issip kétiptu. Seg qari-sa-m issi-p két-ipt-du Gloss look-COND-1SG be.hot-CVB AUX.ket-PST.EVID-3 English but I see it's gotten warm. Timestamp 00:00:28.579-00:00:30.440 IU Tünügün yetmish gradusqa chiqip kétiptu. Speaker B Timestamp 00:40:19.722-00:40:20.871 IU Sizgimu rehmet. Seg siz-gi-mu rehmet Gloss 2SG.POL-DAT-also thanks English Thank you too. Timestamp 00:40:21.795-00:40:22.686 IU Xush wax bolung, Seg xush wax bol-ung Gloss glad time be-2SG.INFM.POSS English Bye, have a good day, Timestamp 00:40:22.686-00:40:23.610 IU yaxshi turung.
